numbered_ace_sentences: 1. This scatter plot shows two variables.
2. One variable is the attitude of 15-to-24-year-olds.
3. The other variable is the attitude of adults.
4. The Pearson correlation between the two variables is minimal.
5. The scatter plot was made to show contrasting attitudes between younger people and adults.
6. Younger people are more optimistic than adults.
7. The audience of this scatter plot can include many kinds of people.
8. The cause of this phenomenon can be analyzed through multiple lenses.
9. The cause of this phenomenon can be analyzed through multiple theories.
10. This graph has a meaning for audiences under the age of 24.
11. This meaning is more sinister than the general meaning.
12. As people get older, they understand more about how ugly the world is.
13. Therefore, older people think that the world is not getting better.
14. Housing prices can soar.
15. Median salaries can stagnate.
16. A common person can be optimistic when the person is young.
17. A young person can hope to be a millionaire.
18. A person can realize the realities of the current economy.
19. If a person realizes the realities of the current economy, then the person can feel depressed.
20. The purpose of this graph is to explain contrasting psychology in younger people and older people.
21. The graph explains how younger people view the world.
22. The graph explains how older people view the world.
23. This graph can explore how people change their perceptions over time.
